meanings.sent1: The landlord tried to dispossess the tenant of the apartment.
meanings.sent2: The government can dispossess land for public projects.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf wanted to dispossess the dragon of its treasure.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to dispossess the trees of their leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer cast a spell to dispossess the hero of his magical powers.

meanings.definition: To take away property or belongings from someone.
meanings.sent1: The thief attempted to dispossess the shopkeeper of his valuable merchandise.
meanings.sent2: The court can dispossess individuals of their assets in cases of fraud.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to dispossess the campers of their snacks.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter seemed to dispossess the garden of its colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The wicked witch plotted to dispossess the princess of her enchanted tiara.
